text: 300px Portrait of Monsieur and Madame Manet is an 1860 portrait by Edouard Manet of his parents, Auguste Manet (1797–1862) and Eugénie Désirée Fournier (1811–1895). It was first exhibited at the 1861 Paris Salon alongside The Spanish Singer. It was initially owned by the painter's brother Eugène before passing to Ernest Rouart's wife Julie Manet. In 1977, ten years after Julie's death, the Rouart-Manet family donated it to the French state, which moved it from the galerie du Jeu de Paume to the musée d'Orsay in 1985, where it still hangs. ==References== Manet Category:Paintings of the Musée d'Orsay Category:1860 paintings
title: Portrait of Monsieur and Madame Manet
